intro: Aceratium erythrocarpum, commonly known as the red-fruited aceratium, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of white hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its fruit is distinctive, being red and berry-like, which gives it its common name. It is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
